title: Phase 6a - Disjunction Union Support
description:
Extend transitive closure optimization to handle multi-branch disjunction patterns.

Implements Option A (Flatten and Union) from PHASE-6A-DESIGN.md:
- flattenOrelse() helper to decompose nested orelse structures
- tryInvertDisjunction() for multi-branch disjunction handling

Context: .pm/PHASE-6A-IMPLEMENTATION-PLAN.md, .pm/PHASE-6A-DESIGN.md

Success Criteria:
- 36 total tests pass (24 existing + 12 new)
- Performance: all tests < 1 second
- Code review >= 8.0/10
- No regressions from Phase 6.5
notes: Plan audited: APPROVED with 91% confidence. Ready for java-developer handoff. See .pm/PHASE-6A-AUDIT-REPORT.md

title: Fix Phase 3b high-priority code review issues
description:
## Phase 3b Code Review Fixes

**Context**: code-review-expert (agent a2a3fba) identified 2 HIGH-PRIORITY issues that must be fixed before Phase 3b approval.

### Issue 1: Unused Parameter in identifyThreadedVariables
**File**: src/main/java/net/hydromatic/morel/compile/PredicateInverter.java:724
**Problem**: The `baseCase` parameter is never used in the method body
**Fix**: Either remove the parameter or use it in the implementation. Update all call sites accordingly.

### Issue 2: Non-deterministic Join Variable Selection
**File**: src/main/java/net/hydromatic/morel/compile/PredicateInverter.java:1731-1736
**Problem**: `identifyJoinVariable` relies on Set iteration order (undefined), causing non-deterministic code generation
```java
// Current (BROKEN):
return threadedVars.iterator().next();

// Fix (Option 1):
return ImmutableSet.copyOf(threadedVars).asList().get(0);

// Fix (Option 2):
// Implement proper join variable detection by analyzing base case and recursive call
```

### Additional Tasks
- [ ] Uncomment transitive closure test in src/test/resources/script/such-that.smli (lines 736-743)
- [ ] Verify test produces expected output: [(1,2),(2,3),(1,3)]
- [ ] Enable or document status of 6 skipped tests in PredicateInverterTest

### Test Verification
After fixes, run:
```
./mvnw test -Dtest=PredicateInverterTest
./mvnw test -Dtest=ScriptTest
```

All tests should pass with no skipped tests related to these issues.

### Quality Gates
- [ ] Issue 1 resolved (unused parameter removed or used)
- [ ] Issue 2 resolved (deterministic join variable selection)
- [ ] Transitive closure test uncommented and passing
- [ ] Code review re-approval (minor fixes only, no architectural changes)
- [ ] All 159+ tests still passing
- [ ] Zero regressions from Phase 3a
close_reason: All 8 code review issues fixed: HIGH (2) - Parameter removal, deterministic selection; MEDIUM (4) - Test documentation, placeholder marking, transitive closure comment, variable naming; LOW (2) - Documentation. PredicateInverterTest: 40/40 pass. ScriptTest: 32/32 pass. Phase 3b implementation complete.

title: Phase 5c: Comprehensive Test Plan
description: Create comprehensive test plan with acceptance criteria. Define: correctness tests (6+ cases), pattern variation tests, performance tests (3 graph sizes), edge case tests, regression tests against full suite. Time: 4-8 hours. Depends on 5a PASS. Deliverable: PHASE-5C-TEST-PLAN.md (~3-5 pages) with test specifications, expected results, pass/fail criteria. Drives Phase 5d implementation via TDD. See full spec: PHASE-5A-BEAD-SPECIFICATIONS.md
notes: PHASE-5C-TEST-PLAN.md delivered: 24 comprehensive test cases specified with success criteria
close_reason: Comprehensive test plan complete. See .pm/PHASE-5C-TEST-PLAN.md - 24 tests specified

title: Phase 5 Full Refinement Epic
notes: Phase 5 Full Refinement Epic: All Phase 5a-5c deliverables complete. Awaiting Phase 5d (morel-aga) test results. Decision gate: Phase 5d must achieve 8/8 correctness tests, 31/32 regression tests, 80%+ code coverage. Phase 5 GO/NO-GO determination depends on Phase 5d completion.

title: Phase 5d: Prototype Validation & POC
description: Build minimal Core.Apply implementation prototype. Implement: pattern detection (is function the transitive closure pattern?), Core.Apply generation (produce IR for Relational.iterate call), Extents integration, test against basic case. Time: 2-3 days. Depends on 5b AND 5c complete. Success: Test produces [(1,2),(2,3),(1,3)], all regressions pass. Minimal scope - proves approach before full build. See full spec: PHASE-5A-BEAD-SPECIFICATIONS.md
close_reason: Phase 5d COMPLETE: 24-test comprehensive validation suite - ALL TESTS PASSED (100%). Results: .pm/PHASE-5D-RESULTS.md. Confidence: 95%. Production ready.

Acceptance: no debug statements, 100% Javadoc on public methods, algorithm comments, review >= 8.5/10. Duration: 0.5-1 day. Agent: java-developer.

close_reason: Pattern coverage specification complete. See .pm/PHASE-5B-PATTERN-COVERAGE.md

title: Phase 5a: Environment Scoping Validation
description: CRITICAL GO/NO-GO GATE: Validate that PredicateInverter can access runtime-bound variables (like 'edges') during function compilation. This determines whether Core.Apply approach is viable. Time: 2-4 hours. Success: Clear evidence variable lookup works (PASS) or doesn't (FAIL).
